_header: O wretched sinner whatsoever you be
_description: John Lydgate, ‘On the Image of Pity’ — five 8-line stanzas

BodAsh59.First Lines:
O wrechched synner what so ever þowe beWith hert indurate
                    herder þane þe stooneTurne hider in haste kneele doune beholde
                    and seþe moder of criste whas hert was woo begone…
BodAsh59.Last Lines:
…þat holsome stories shewed in figurMay rest with vs in
                    moste duwe remembrance
BodAsh59.Attributed Title:
Here foloweþe a devoute exortacoun to meeve men devoutely to þe
                    ymage of pyte by orisounes and preyers (f. 68v)

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
O wretched synner what so ever thow bewith herte endurat hardar
                    than þe stone…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…that holsom storyes thus shewyd in fygurMay rest with ws with
                    dewe remembraunce
BLAdd29729.Note:
Ends, ‘Amen / finis lidgat’ (f. 130; all by scribe, John
                    Stow).
